body:
### Problem

**Description:**
The crash happened randomly multiple times while editing code in Rust or JS. 
LSPs used during crash: rust_analyzer, tsserver, taplo.
I have also observed a slowdown while editing or moving, neovim became a bit less responsive to text input with some delays. 
Slowdowns might have also been triggered by noice + notify plugins since, especially Rust LSP generated too many update messages, so I disabled noice. nvim started to work a bit quicker, though, the main problem didn't go away. 
The MacOS uptime has been about 2 weeks. 
After system reboot today, the lightning fast responsiveness of neovim was restored.
The frequency of crashes reduced as well. 4 crashes happened today in comparence to 21 yesterday.

**Crash history:**
1) 06.07: First crash ever occurred 
2) 11.07: Another one
3) 12.07: 21 crashes
4) 13.07: 4 crashes so far. 

**Latest Neovim crash report:**


> 1. 06.07: First crash ever occurred

Did you update to Nvim 0.9.1 that day? Or update some plugins? 

The stacktraces still look useless, so either you must narrow down the problem to a specific plugin or minimal configuration, or build older Nvim and bisect the Nvim commits until you find the exact Nvim commit that causes the issue. 

Your last report mentions:

> Path:                  /usr/local/Cellar/neovim/0.9.1/bin/nvim

So I guess you haven't tried building latest Nvim master...?

> Did you update to Nvim 0.9.1 that day? Or update some plugins?
@justinmk unfortunately, I update my plugins many times a day, since lazy.nvim notifies me every time new plugin updates are out.  

I've rebuilt 0.9.1 in Debug mode as asked @zeertzjq yesterday. 
Waiting for the issue to be reproduced for debug build for this version. 
I haven't tried the latest master, since we are searching for concrete bug in 0.9.1.

So right now I'm running a Debug 0.9.1 version. 
Should I do `:redir >> nvim.log`? Can it help to spot the issue?

> I haven't tried the latest master, since we are searching for concrete bug in 0.9.1.

That's fine, but bisecting to a specific commit will help a lot.

> > I haven't tried the latest master, since we are searching for concrete bug in 0.9.1.
> 
> That's fine, but bisecting to a specific commit will help a lot.

A pretty tedious time consuming task with plenty of rebuilds, no easier way?
